intro: Cerastium capense, commonly known as the Cape mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically rounded and covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Cerastium capense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
